In [4] Fomin and Golovach established equivalence of prfâ¢(G)prfğº\mbox{prf}(G)prf ( italic_G ) to other parameters including one important in graph searching. Further areas of application of the profile and equivalent parameters include computational biology [2, 6], archaeology [9] and clone fingerprinting [8]. The following is a well-known NP-complete problem [3, 10].

Minimum Profile Problem (MPP)
Instance: A graph G=(V,E)ğºğ‘‰ğ¸G=(V,E)italic_G = ( italic_V , italic_E ) and a positive integer kğ‘˜kitalic_k.
Question: Does GğºGitalic_G have an ordering of profile â‰¤kabsentğ‘˜\leq kâ‰¤ italic_k?

In fact this problem is equivalent to the following problem that have been proved to be NP-complete even earlier (see [5]). A graph G=(V,E)ğºğ‘‰ğ¸G=(V,E)italic_G = ( italic_V , italic_E ) is interval if we can associate each vertex vâˆˆVğ‘£ğ‘‰v\in Vitalic_v âˆˆ italic_V with a closed interval Ivsubscriptğ¼ğ‘£I_{v}italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the real line such that two distinct vertices xğ‘¥xitalic_x and yğ‘¦yitalic_y are adjacent in GğºGitalic_G if and only if Ixâˆ©Iyâ‰ âˆ….subscriptğ¼ğ‘¥subscriptğ¼ğ‘¦I_{x}\cap I_{y}\neq\emptyset.italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ© italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰  âˆ… .

Interval Graph Completion (IGC)
Instance: A graph G=(V,E)ğºğ‘‰ğ¸G=(V,E)italic_G = ( italic_V , italic_E ) and a positive integer kâ‰¥|E|ğ‘˜ğ¸k\geq|E|italic_k â‰¥ | italic_E |.
Question: Is there a supergraph Gâ€²superscriptğºâ€²G^{\prime}italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT of GğºGitalic_G such that Gâ€²superscriptğºâ€²G^{\prime}italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is an interval graph and it contains at most kğ‘˜kitalic_k edges?

The equivalence between MPP and IGC follows from the next result:

Theorem 1.1

[1] For any graph GğºGitalic_G prfâ¢(G)prfğº\mbox{prf}(G)prf ( italic_G ) equals the smallest number of edges in an interval supergraph of GğºGitalic_G.

Thus, for every graph GğºGitalic_G, prfâ¢(Eâ¢(G))â‰¥|E|.prfğ¸ğºğ¸\mbox{prf}(E(G))\geq|E|.prf ( italic_E ( italic_G ) ) â‰¥ | italic_E | . Hence, the following parameterized problem is FPT.

Profile Problem (PP)
Instance: A graph G=(V,E).ğºğ‘‰ğ¸G=(V,E).italic_G = ( italic_V , italic_E ) . Parameter: A positive integer kğ‘˜kitalic_k.
Question: Does GğºGitalic_G have an ordering of profile â‰¤kabsentğ‘˜\leq kâ‰¤ italic_k?

Several authors consider the following much more interesting and problem; in fact, it is unknown whether the problem is FPT (private communications with L. Cai, F. Fomin and H. Kaplan).

Profile Above Guaranteed Value (PAGV)
Instance: A graph G=(V,E).ğºğ‘‰ğ¸G=(V,E).italic_G = ( italic_V , italic_E ) . Parameter: A positive integer kğ‘˜kitalic_k.
Question: Does GğºGitalic_G have an ordering of profile â‰¤|E|+kabsentğ¸ğ‘˜\leq|E|+kâ‰¤ | italic_E | + italic_k?

Unfortunately, we are not able to determine the complexity of this problem. In this paper, we consider a somewhat weaker version of MPAGV. We restrict ourselves to connected graphs (the case of general graphs can be reduced to connected graphs). Since |E|â‰¥|V|âˆ’1ğ¸ğ‘‰1|E|\geq|V|-1| italic_E | â‰¥ | italic_V | - 1 for a connected graph G=(V,E),ğºğ‘‰ğ¸G=(V,E),italic_G = ( italic_V , italic_E ) , consider the following:

Profile Above Vertex Guaranteed Value (PAVGV)
Instance: A connected graph G=(V,E).ğºğ‘‰ğ¸G=(V,E).italic_G = ( italic_V , italic_E ) . Parameter: A positive integer kğ‘˜kitalic_k.
Question: Does GğºGitalic_G have an ordering of profile â‰¤|V|âˆ’1+kabsentğ‘‰1ğ‘˜\leq|V|-1+kâ‰¤ | italic_V | - 1 + italic_k?

This problem is of interest also because of Problem VAP by Serna and Thilikos [11] (see Section 5). We will prove by means of a kernelization scheme that the problem PAVGV is fixed-parameter tractable.

Theorem 2.5 gives a lower bound of the profile of a 2-edge-connected graph, which is important for our FPT algorithm. Lin and Yuan [10] used a concise and elegant argument to show that prfâ¢(G)â‰¥kâ¢(2â¢nâˆ’kâˆ’1)/2prfğºğ‘˜2ğ‘›ğ‘˜12\mbox{prf}(G)\geq k(2n-k-1)/2prf ( italic_G ) â‰¥ italic_k ( 2 italic_n - italic_k - 1 ) / 2 for every kğ‘˜kitalic_k-connected graph GğºGitalic_G of order nğ‘›nitalic_n. Their argument uses Mengerâ€™s Theorem in a clever way, yet the argument cannot be used to prove our bound. Instead of Mengerâ€™s Theorem we will apply the following well-known decomposition of 2-edge-connected graphs (see, e.g., Theorem 4.2.10 in [12]) called a closed-ear decomposition.

Corollary 4.6

The problem PAVGV is fixed-parameter tractable.

5 NP-completeness

Serna and Thilikos [11] asked whether the following problem is FPT.

Vertex Average Profile (VAP)
